channel.title: [pi]pvp point shop[pi]
channel.description: my source already has a pvp point shop and stuff but i added a new item into that shop but i cant seem to figure out how to make the item cost pvp points. right now it just says it costs 0 pvp points like its free, but idk how to set a value for it in pvp points O-o

item.title: [pi]pvp point shop[pi]
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=485400.msg3556395#msg3556395 date=1301938891]
ShopAssistant - getSpecialItemValue();
[/quote]That method, inside the ShopAssistant class.

It will look like this:

public int getSpecialItemValue(int id) { switch (id) { case ITEM_ID: return PRICE_OF_ITEM; } }[/quote]

ok, so do i just add that anywhere in the shopassistant.java file? and after the getSpecialItemValue is the int id like an id id or is that just part of the code?

Read full topic

} if (c.myShopId == 47) { c.sendMessage(c.getItems().getItemName(removeId)+": currently costs " + getSpecialItemValue(removeId) + " PvP points."); return;
